item.title: The Argument for The Outer Worlds 2 to Include More Endings Than the Original
item.description:
Summary

  • More endings in The Outer Worlds 2 would offer greater player agency.
  • An increased number of endings could lead to more complex outcomes from players' decisions.
  • Having more endings in The Outer Worlds 2 would boost its replay value as well.

Almost any RPG enthusiast is likely to leap for joy when they hear mention of a game having multiple endings, as it suggests there are potentially some very important choices presented to them during the game's narrative. Obsidian Entertainment's The Outer Worlds is one such RPG with three endings, each of which is profoundly impacted by some key decisions players make throughout the game's story. Now, with The Outer Worlds 2 on the horizon, it is expected to have multiple endings as well, but there remains an argument for it to feature an even greater number of conclusions.

There are plenty of reasons why The Outer Worlds 2 might benefit from having more endings than the first game, with the most notable reasons being tied to player agency, replay value, and complexity of outcomes. This doesn't necessarily mean that having more endings would work all the way around for The Outer Worlds 2 , but the case still stands.

Why The Outer Worlds 2 Should Have More Endings Than the Original

More Endings in The Outer Worlds 2 Would Mean Greater Player Agency

The clearest way The Outer Worlds 2 could benefit from having more endings than the first game is the increase in player agency it would likely produce. It's simple math, really, as more endings should, in theory, mean an even wider range of choices for players to make as they progress through The Outer Worlds 2 's story. That being said, in order for the choices that lead to those endings to feel important, the endings themselves would need to feel important as well. As long as each of The Outer Worlds 2 's endings felt distinct from one another, rather than their sole differences being an additional cutscene or something similar, it could certainly get away with having more endings than the first game.

More Endings in The Outer Worlds 2 Would Allow for More Complex Outcomes

Another reason The Outer Worlds 2 might want to have more endings than the first game is that it would potentially allow players to make more complex choices that lead to more diverse outcomes. For example, an RPG with two endings simply suggests a binary choice system, which is typically represented in the form of good versus evil. The Outer Worlds does have three endings — one good, one bad, and one really bad — but including even more endings would potentially allow for more morally gray choices during the game's narrative, which could potentially cause it to break away from the standard binary results that are to be expected.

More Endings in The Outer Worlds 2 Would Increase Its Replay Value

Finally, and perhaps most obviously, giving The Outer Worlds 2 more endings than the first game would inevitably increase its replay value, especially if the game were to place limitations on save scumming or multiple key choices presented to them throughout the game that are impossible to reverse. Having more than three endings (with the appropriate save-scumming limitations in place), The Outer Worlds 2 might encourage players to replay the game multiple times, rather than simply reloading an old save to change their decision. This would, in turn, increase the game's lifespan, which is something any developer wants for its game.

The clearest way The Outer Worlds 2 could benefit from having more endings than the first game is the increase in player agency it would likely produce.

Overall, the greater player agency, the potential for more complex outcomes, and the increase in replay value that more than three endings would offer The Outer Worlds 2 are difficult to deny. Again, however, The Outer Worlds 2 would need to ensure these endings are very distinct from one another in order to make witnessing each one of them worth it, as well as the choices that are required to achieve them. At the very least, fans can be sure that The Outer Worlds 2 , like many other Obsidian Entertainment games, will include multiple endings, even if there aren't more than the first game.

item.title: EA Sports UFC 5: How to Turn On Stamina Bar
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Enable the Fighter HUD
  • Fighter HUD Dynamic/On Advantages

EA Sports UFC 5 is still the only game for fans of mixed martial arts, ready to test their fighting skills inside the Octagon. The game continues to be supported with updates to the ever-expanding roster. It also adds new venues like the Las Vegas Sphere. You can alter EA Sports UFC 5's settings to tailor the experience to your liking. Looking for an intense simulation for a realistic fight, or something more fast-paced and arcade-like? Change some settings and find out what you like best.

Most modes require you to manage your fighter's stamina during a fight. Running out of stamina causes your fighter's techniques to slow, and you will receive more damage from incoming strikes. Your fighter will also be easier to take down and submit as you won't be able to effectively fight back. Thankfully, you can enable a Stamina Bar on your onscreen HUD. This can aid you in managing your fighter's stamina and teach you their limits. Continue reading this guide to learn how to turn on the Stamina Bars in EA Sports UFC 5, and which type you may prefer.

Enable the Fighter HUD

Go to settings on the main menu of EA Sports UFC 5. Click on the Game Style settings. Here is where you can tweak the simulation aspects down to individual sliders . You can change the Game Style to make large changes and determine how realistic the fights will be. Tweaking the settings below will change the Game Style to Custom. Finalizing your settings from the main menu will apply them to every game mode.

Scroll down to find the Fighter HUD. Set the Fighter HUD to On or Dynamic to enable visible Stamina Bars in EA Sports UFC 5.

Fighter HUD Dynamic/On Advantages

Both versions of the Fighter HUD will give you valuable information during a fight. The Dynamic option is less obtrusive. This version of the HUD always displays the Stamina Bar. Taking damage and attacking while stamina is low will drain the meter so it does not fully recover. Small symbols will appear underneath it, indicating cuts and damage. The health bars for your fighter's various body parts will only appear once they've received significant damage.

When the Fighter HUD is set to On, all of your fighter's stamina/health bars will be present on screen. It can be distracting in a fight, but very useful in practice mode. Playing certain multiplayer fight modes will still disable all Fighter HUD elements regardless of your personal settings.

item.title: Scrapped Call of Duty: WW2 Battle Royale Footage Leaks
item.description:
Summary

  • Leaked footage reveals Sledgehammer Games was once developing a battle royale mode for Call of Duty: WW2.
  • Call of Duty's first battle royale mode was introduced in 2018 with Black Ops 4.
  • 2020 saw the release of Call of Duty: Warzone, a new battle royale experience that has become one of the most popular in the genre.

A new leak suggests Call of Duty: WW2 developer Sledgehammer Games was once working on a battle royale mode for the 2017 shooter. While Call of Duty: WW2 could have been the first entry in the franchise to implement such a mode, it was Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 that would make the leap into the battle royale genre, followed by the monumentally successfully Call of Duty: Warzone , which launched in March 2020.

While most Call of Duty fans will be familiar with Warzone , which quickly took over the battle royale genre in 2020, going toe-to-toe with the likes of Fortnite and Apex Legends, Black Ops 4 's Blackout mode was Call of Duty 's first attempt at the mode. Similar to many other battle royale titles, Blackout allowed players to drop into one of two maps, either solo or with teammates, loot weapons scattered around the island, and be the last one standing. Plenty of Call of Duty fans will have fond memories of "the original Warzone, " but it looks like a battle royale mode was almost implemented before the release of Black Ops 4 .

Call of Duty: WW2 Battle Royale Footage Leaks

Although it won't go down as one of the greatest entries in the franchise, Call of Duty: WW2 launched with some spectacular modes that were loved by fans. Despite WW2 already breaking the typical Call of Duty formula by implementing a Headquarters Hub, an epic new War mode, and more, Sledgehammer Games was also reportedly working on a battle royale mode. Despite being almost eight years old, new footage has been shared on Twitter by user Liam of a supposed battle royale mode for Call of Duty: WW2 . Given that development on the mode was never completed, the footage doesn't show much, but it is interesting to get a glimpse at what could have been the original Blackout or Warzone ​​​​​​.

Unlike Blackout, which was tied to Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 , Warzone is a free-to-play title that can be downloaded by anybody on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, and PC. As the title is its own separate entity, it is regularly updated with new content and gameplay changes. Although not directly tied to one specific game, each new mainline Call of Duty game is fully integrated with Warzone , meaning content such as weapons, battle passes, and more are shared between two titles simultaneously. The latest integration was with the hugely successful Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 , which brought some big gameplay changes to Warzone , such as a new omnidirectional movement system.

Unfortunately, while it remains one of the most popular battle royale games on the market, Call of Duty: Warzone ​​​​​​is in a dire state right now. While a new season is on the horizon, with plenty of improvements already confirmed by Activision, the publisher did reveal that there would be less content than originally planned for Call of Duty: Warzone Season 2. The studio says this is to prioritize new gameplay improvements, bug fixes, quality-of-life updates, and more. Season 2 launches on January 28 for both Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Call of Duty: Warzone .

item.title: The Sims 4: Best Food & Restaurant Mods
item.description:
Summary

  • Mods enhance The Sims 4: Dine Out experience, adding new features like faster cooking and extended employee shifts.
  • Custom mods introduce additional menu items, restaurant events, and flexible employee hiring for more immersive gameplay.
  • With caution, modding can enhance the player's gaming experience, but one should be aware of potential risks and conflicts among mods.

In the bustling virtual world of The Sims 4 , the promising Dine Out game pack brought exciting opportunities for players to immerse themselves in the restaurant industry and have their Sims discover new recipes by eating at restaurants in town. However, with the initial excitement came a slew of frustrating glitches and limitations that hindered the full potential of restaurant ownership and dining experiences.

Enter a beacon of hope in the form of mods crafted by dedicated Simmers to breathe new life into the Dine Out experience. From simple tweaks to game changers like new recipes and features, many mods seek to remedy the annoyances of Dine Out while enhancing overall restaurant gameplay.

Updated January 23, 2025 by Jenna Amore: Although the Dine Out game pack offers a foundation for running restaurants, many players find themselves wishing for more depth and variety. To address this, this list has been updated to showcase the best food and restaurant mods, each designed to elevate culinary gameplay.

From expanding menu options and enhancing restaurant management to creating more immersive dining experiences for Sims, these mods bring fresh ideas and exciting features. Whether players aim to streamline operations or add a unique flair to cafés and eateries, these mods provide everything needed to go beyond the basics of Dine Out.

Modding can enhance your gaming experience, but it also comes with risks. Exercise caution when downloading mods, as they may potentially break your game. Players should always ensure that they are downloading from reputable sources and keeping their mod folder updated by checking the mod's website regularly, especially after game updates. These mods may conflict with each other when installed together.

1 Better Chef's Kitchen

Downloads: 26,954

  • Created by BosseLadyTV
  • Requires: The Sims 4: City Living
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

Gamers can enhance Sims' culinary prowess with the Better Chef's Kitchen mod, a versatile addition for restaurants and home chefs in The Sims 4 . It takes the Chef's Kitchen lot trait from City Living and expands its benefits to include baking, gourmet cooking, mixology, juice fizzing, and nectar-making skills. This custom lot trait is good for residential lots and businesses such as restaurants and cafes.

This mod requires packs like Get To Work , Eco Lifestyle , and Horse Ranch for full functionality, but even with just City Living and the base game, Sims can enjoy accelerated skill development in cooking, baking, and gourmet cooking.

2 Employees Stay 24 Hours Mod

Downloads: 8,223

  • Created by Mythical_Ascelin
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

With this mod, a simple tweak revolutionizes restaurant gameplay. Originally, Sim restaurant employees only stayed for short shifts before requesting to head home for the day. This limitation often restricts restaurant owners from extending their business hours and maximizing their restaurant earnings.

The Employees Stay 24 Hours Mod does exactly as it says. Employees will willingly work full 24-hour shifts before needing to clock out. This allows restaurant owners to keep their establishments open for longer durations, which enables players to generate more revenue and indulge in extended, uninterrupted gameplay sessions.

3 Restaurant Grand Opening Mod

Downloads: 18,555

  • Created by KiaraSims4Mods
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

Building the perfect restaurant takes a lot of time and consideration, and opening a new restaurant for the first time can feel underwhelming. Thankfully, the Restaurant Grand Opening Mod allows restaurant owners to host an event that will attract customers and celebrate the business' launch.

There are various goals for the restaurant owner to achieve to throw a successful social event. The main goal is to welcome customers, but interactions like checking on tables; giving free meals, drinks, and desserts; and recommending food dishes can bring players closer to a gold star event. As a reward for a great grand opening, players will receive a What's On The Menu sign and 10–50 Simoleons in tips.

4 Hire Teens For Restaurants Mod

Downloads: 47,120

  • Created by c82118
  • Download Here (Mod The Sims)

This tuning mod offers a small fix for players with unemployed teenage Sims. The base game only allows teens to work part-time jobs such as babysitting, lifeguarding, and manual labor. Unfortunately, The Sims 4 only allows restaurant positions for young adults, adults, and elders. The Hire Teens For Restaurants Mod expands teen employment roles within the bustling culinary world.

Teenagers can now be hired as hosts, servers, or even chefs, contributing to the efficient operation of the restaurant. Beyond its practical implications, this mod also adds depth to gameplay by reflecting real-world diversity in the workforce. Players can now create dynamic narratives involving ambitious teens eager to gain work experience and contribute to their family's income.

5 Custom Food Interactions

Downloads: 2,556,118

  • Created by TheFoodGroup
  • Download Here (Mod The Sims)

The Custom Food Interactions mod is a must-have for Sims 4 players who love to experiment in the kitchen or run a thriving restaurant. This mod introduces new interactions, allowing Sims to create a variety of custom meals, drinks, desserts, and snacks. With recipes ranging from soups and salads to shakes and treats, it significantly expands the range of dishes Sims can prepare.

Beyond just cooking, this mod empowers skilled Sims to turn their passion into profit. They can sell their custom food creations to local shops or even start a home-based catering business. This feature is ideal for restaurant owners and chefs, as it allows players to build a unique menu that stands out from the usual base game offerings.

6 Functional Custom Bar

Downloads: N/A

  • Created by Insinnia
  • Download Custom Bar Here (Patreon)
  • Download More Drinks Here (Patreon)

The Functional Custom Bar mod introduces a new bar from buy mode with an extensive drink menu, featuring 11 name-brand beers, such as Budweiser, Samuel Adams, and Guinness. For Simmers who want to expand their drink options even further, an add-on by the same creator offers classic cocktails like mimosas, margaritas, and daiquiris, giving Sims a taste of real-world favorites.

Ideal for building lively bars, upscale lounges, or casual restaurants, this mod allows Sims to enjoy a wider variety of drinks when dining out. Whether they're grabbing a cold beer with friends or sipping on a cocktail at the bar, the Functional Custom Bar mod brings more authenticity and variety to The Sims 4 's dining and nightlife scenes.

7 Drinks Machine

Downloads: N/A

  • Created by Littlbowbub
  • Download Here (Patreon)

Looking to diversify Sims' drink menus? The Drinks Machine mod introduces a versatile drink machine object that offers a wide range of beverages, including hot drinks, sodas, milkshakes, and slushies. The convenience of having a single machine that serves multiple types of drinks makes it a practical and valuable asset for any business or restaurant.

The drinks machine comes in an array of colors and patterns, allowing players to select a design that perfectly matches the aesthetic of their business. Whether it's running a trendy cafe, a family diner, or a high-end restaurant, there’s a design that will fit seamlessly into any establishment.

8 More Cafe Options

Downloads: N/A

  • Created by Littlebowbub
  • Requires: The Sims 4: Get Together
  • Download Here (Patreon)

For Sims who prefer hands-on cafe management, the More Cafe Options mod is the perfect way to elevate their menu beyond just a basic drink machine. Cafe owners can offer a wider variety of food, including cakes, light bites, sweet treats, and pies. Plus, there are plenty of new coffee options, such as lattes and specialty brews, that allow Sims to customize their drink orders.

Whether Sims are grabbing a quick snack or indulging in a delicious dessert, the expanded menu makes dining out more enjoyable and realistic. For cafe owners, it opens up new opportunities to craft unique menus and attract more customers, making it a valuable addition for anyone looking to build a cozy, successful coffee shop or restaurant in The Sims 4 .

9 More Restaurant Menu Options Mod

Downloads: N/A

  • Created by MizoreYukki
  • Download Here (Patreon)

The More Restaurant Menu Options mod empowers restaurant owners to expand their menu offerings, providing customers with a wider array of choices to tantalize their taste buds. Originally, each restaurant could only choose 30 meals for their menus. This can become limiting for ambitious restaurateurs who aim to offer a diverse range of dishes.

Two files are available for download. One increases the options to 50, while the other brings the total to 100. Players should choose one of these to install at a time. This flexibility allows players to tailor their establishments to their preferences and the needs of their customers.

10 Hungry Plumbobs Fast Food Counter

Downloads: N/A

  • Created by Littlebowbub
  • Download Here (Patreon)

When there are Sims who are starving and on the brink of death, waiting for a slowpoke chef is not going to cut it. The Hungry Plumbobs Fast Food Counter mod adds a fast food counter designed for quick and efficient service. Sims can conveniently order a variety of meals, pizza, and snacks, ensuring they get their fill without the lengthy wait times.

Available in four different color combinations, this counter can seamlessly fit into any restaurant or fast food joint's decor. This mod not only enhances the dining experience by offering quick service but also adds a visually appealing element to Sims' culinary businesses.

11 Hungry Plumbobs Fast Food Delivery

Downloads: N/A

  • Created by Littlebowbub
  • Requires: Hungry Plumbob Fast Food (Tumblr)
  • Download Here (Patreon)

The Hungry Plumbobs Fast Food Delivery mod brings a modern, convenient twist to dining in The Sims 4. Much like real-world services like Uber Eats, Grubhub, and DoorDash, this mod lets Sims skip the cooking and enjoy their favorite fast food without leaving their home. Beyond the classic pizza delivery, players can now have full meals delivered, including options like chicken, burgers, and fries.

This mod expands the dining possibilities by making fast food more accessible, enhancing the cooking and eating experience for Sims who want a quick, delicious meal. Whether it's a lazy night in or a busy day with no time to cook, the Hungry Plumbobs Fast Food Delivery mod ensures that Sims can always enjoy a convenient, tasty meal.

12 Delivery — Healthy Food

Downloads: 1,171,483

  • Created by Somik_Severinka
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

The Delivery — Healthy Food mod introduces a nutritious twist to The Sims 4 by allowing Sims to order a variety of healthy dishes and snacks through a new delivery service. With nineteen wholesome meals and five refreshing smoothies, this mod encourages Sims to develop a healthier lifestyle by offering foods with negative calorie content.

The addition of seven pre-prepared meal kits for each day of the week not only adds convenience but also inspires players to explore new ways of meal planning for their households. This mod is perfect for Sims who are fitness enthusiasts or simply want to embrace clean eating. It also complements the restaurant experience by giving players more options to include health-conscious meals.

13 Restaurant Host Career Mod

Downloads: 52,399

  • Created by KiaraSims4Mods
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

A host or hostess career is perfect for teenagers, who can work in the restaurant business thanks to the previous mod. This mod allows Sims of any age to dip their toes in the service industry by taking on the role of host or hostess specifically. Hosts are responsible for welcoming customers and seating customers at their tables.

They will work a total of five eight-hour shifts each week, for §16 per hour. It certainly doesn't rank among the highest-paid careers in The Sims 4 , but it is just as important as any other career. There are no promotions in this career, but Sims in this role can practice their charisma skills to be better prepared for work. If a Sim is ready to take the next step, they might be interested in becoming a server or chef.

14 Restaurant Faster Cooking Mod

Downloads: 142,267

  • Created by LittleMsSam
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

Chefs are known to be a little slow to complete their jobs, with no fault towards their character. The Restaurant Faster Cooking mod provides some quick fixes to the glitchy Dine Out game pack and the chef role in particular. The pack allows restaurant owners to choose between three different speeds for their chefs to cook at - Careful , Normal , and Quick - and this mod increases these speeds even further.

If the restaurant isn't teeming with customers, the owner may ask them to cook slowly and carefully to ensure the meal is of excellent quality. On the other hand, a quick pace might be better suited for a busier time to better satisfy customers and their hunger. In addition to changing the speed of cooking, the creator of this mod has also increased the speed of interactions involving pots, pans, and cutting boards.

15 Coworkers Hang Out Event Mod

Downloads: 106,178

  • Created by Ilkavelle
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

After closing the restaurant for the day, employees who enjoy the company of their coworkers may want to stick around and have a beer or two. Without the Coworkers Hang Out Event Mod , employees would leave the lot immediately after the restaurant closed. The restaurant manager can now host a custom event called the Coworkers Hangout and invite their employees to stay after hours. It costs §25 to book this event.

Building better relationships with coworkers helps the restaurant run smoother and gives employees a greater appreciation for their bosses. Finishing with a gold star status rewards the business with extra influence points to buy better perks for the restaurant.

16 Hire Certain Sims At Restaurants Mod

Downloads: 311,492

  • Created by LittleMsSam
  • Requires: XML Injector (Curseforge)
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

Running a family restaurant? It may be a little difficult to execute using Dine Out alone. There is a limited pool of Sims that restaurant owners are allowed to pull from. Thankfully, there's a mod that can help some players out. The Hire Certain Sims At Restaurants mod allows a restaurant owner to choose exactly which Sim they'd like to hire from the entire save file.

This makes it easy to hire family members and friends and, in turn, allows for more interesting storylines. At the host station, players can assign these Sims a trait for their position (host/server/chef). This will make sure the Sim will earn the necessary skills needed to work at the restaurant.

17 Medieval Cookbook

Downloads: N/A

  • Created by Littlbowbub
  • Requires: Homestead Helper Mod (Patreon) and Starter Medieval Cookbook Recipes (Patreon)
  • Download Here (Patreon)

For players seeking a historical twist, the Medieval Cookbook mod is a must-have addition to The Sims 4 . This mod introduces a specialized cookbook filled with recipes inspired by medieval cuisine, perfect for creating a unique culinary experience. Whether it's whipping up hearty broths, savory pies, or classic puddings, these dishes fit seamlessly into medieval-themed restaurants and historical gameplay.

Ideal for challenges like the Decades Challenge, it helps players fully immerse themselves in a historical setting. With frequent updates and new recipes in the works, the Medieval Cookbook keeps Sims’ kitchens as timeless as the meals they prepare.

18 TianaSims Cookbook & Occult Recipebook

Downloads: N/A

  • Created by TianaSims
  • Requires: Recipes (Patreon)
  • Download Cookbook Here (Patreon)
  • Download Occult Recipebook Here (Patreon)

The TianaSims Cookbook and Occult Recipebook mods bring an extraordinary variety of custom recipes to The Sims 4 , making them indispensable for players who love experimenting with food. The new Cookbook offers a wide range of menus, including breakfast, meals, desserts, drinks, baking, pet food, and even canning, allowing Sims to craft dishes tailored to their lifestyles. With customizable options like renaming the book or selecting specific recipes to include, it ensures every player has a personalized culinary experience.

Meanwhile, the Occult Recipebook — also known as the Recipe Grimoire — caters to occult Sims with 39 enchanting recipes that have unique effects, like soothing acne or sparking magical reactions. These mods not only expand cooking possibilities but also add flair to supernatural-themed restaurants, from charming cafés to mystical dining establishments.

19 Oni's Recipe Pack

Downloads: N/A

  • Created by Oni
  • Download Here (Patreon)

With Oni's Recipe Pack mod, players can elevate their Sims' culinary adventures through a collection of over 45 new recipes. Using a custom paper grocery bag item, Sims can explore baking delicate pastries, cooking cultural favorites like sukiyaki and rose pasta, or preparing flavorful sandwiches such as Caprese and egg mayo. The ability to download recipes individually lets players curate their game to suit their tastes, making this mod both flexible and versatile.

These creative dishes not only enhance the cooking and baking experience but also allow for more dynamic menus in restaurants. Whether running an upscale international eatery or a bakery with unlimited menu options, this mod adds a fresh layer of creativity to Sims’ food experience.

20 Food & Beverage Supplier License

Downloads: N/A

  • Created by Simsonian Library
  • Download Here (Patreon)

The Food & Beverage Supplier License mod is a game-changer for Sims aspiring to become successful entrepreneurs in the food and beverage industry. For 500 satisfaction points, Sims can acquire a new reward trait that allows them to sell a wide range of items, including fresh produce, fish, meat, ingredients, beverages, and more. These items can be sold to vendors, baristas, bartenders, restaurants, and other business owners for a profit.

Sims with this trait must maintain good customer relationships, check up on them, and offer discounts. This functionality not only enhances the realism of running a supply business but also provides strategic opportunities for Sims to build a loyal customer base.

item.title: Wuthering Waves: Roccia Build Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Roccia Build In Wuthering Waves
  • Roccia Best Echo In Wuthering Waves
  • Roccia Best Weapons In Wuthering Waves

Roccia is a Sub-DPS character who deals Havoc DMG in Wuthering Waves . She relies on Plunge attacks to build her Concerto Energy, which she can fill effortlessly. Not to mention, her Outro Skill grants the next character 20% Havoc DMG and 25% Basic ATK DMG.

A fast rotation with a big Havoc buff makes Roccia one of the best Sub-DPS units in Wuthering Waves . Of course, no character can be good or complete without a proper build. For that, this is the best way to build Roccia in Wuthering Waves .

Roccia Build In Wuthering Waves

Weapons

Echo Set

Echoes Stats

  1. Tragicomedy
  2. Verity's Handle
  3. Stonard
  4. Marcato

Main Echo:

  • Nightmare: Impermanence Heron
  • Impermanence Heron
  • Bell-Borne Geochelone

Echo Sets:

  • Midnight Veil
  • Moonlit Clouds

  • Cost 4: Crit Rate
  • Cost 3: Havoc DMG
  • Cost 3: Havoc DMG
  • Cost 1: ATK
  • Cost 1: ATK
  • Subs: Crit Rate, Crit DMG, Heavy ATK DMG, ATK

Roccia Best Echo In Wuthering Waves

Building Roccia is easy in Wuthering Waves . As a unit that buffs other units with her Outro Skill, it’s important to build Roccia with an Echo set that further improves that ability. For that, Midnight Veil is a viable option since it increases her Havoc DMG by 10% while giving her a huge strike when she leaves the field on top of further buffing the next character’s Havoc DMG by 15%. This allows Roccia to form a great pair with characters like Camellya and Havoc Rover. You can also build Roccia with the Moonlit Clouds Echo set to grant the next character around 22% ATK buff. It’s always a safe option for Sub-DPS units like Roccia.

As for the Main Echo, build Roccia with Nightmare: Impermanence Heron if you choose Midnight Veil, and go for the standard Impermanence Heron if you build her with Moonlit Clouds. Nightmare: Impermanence Heron purely buffs her own DMG while Impermanence Heron helps her to further amplify the next character’s DMG by 12%.

That’s not all, it’s also important to build Roccia with at least 70% Crit Rate to take full advantage of her Resonance Liberation that buffs the entire team’s ATK by 200. For that, her Cost 4 Echo (the Impermanence Heron) should have a Crit Rate main stat.

Roccia Best Weapons In Wuthering Waves

For the best Roccia weapon, there’s no doubt that her best-in-slot is her signature weapon, Tragicomedy. The Gauntlet gives a 24% Crit Rate increase on top of a passive that boosts her ATK% and Heavy ATK DMG. Roccia can definitely take full advantage of Tragicomedy since most of her attacks are considered Heavy ATK DMG.

While the rest of the weapons are not that good on Roccia, you can always target Gauntlets with Crit Rate Sub-stat to fulfill this requirement for her. Verity's Handle is a good 5-star weapon that will grant her the Crit Rate she needs, but nothing notable from its passive.

As for 4-star weapons, go for Stonard or Marcato as an F2P choice. Stonard for its Crit Rate Sub, while Marcato is a decent choice as it speeds up her rotation because of its passive that grants her some Concerto Energy.
